description: Users might experience unexpected disclosure of sensitive information when utilizing the Windows Remote Access Connection Manager. This issue can lead to unauthorized exposure of data which could pose a privacy risk in environments that rely heavily on remote connectivity. Particular builds are affected, notably including 10.0.19045.4291, 10.0.19044.4291, and 10.0.22631.3447, among others. The KB articles associated, such as KB-5037788, provide further details about patching and recognizing the affected components. As an important severity type issue, administrators should monitor user reports regarding information exposure closely and ensure system updates are applied.
